channel.title: Notes on Today I learnt
channel.description: Recent content in Notes on Today I learnt

item.title: TIL: sync iPhone photos in Linux
item.description: I wrote a script that imports photos from iPhone into my Linux machine, converts HEIF/HEIC images into regular JPGs and MOV videos into VP9 videos in MKV. While I was doing that, I learnt a bit about rsync, HandBrackeCLI, libheif and I'm sharing it here with the script itself. Prerequisites First of all, the tools that I needed to install. I'm using Arch Linux so all the package names and commands are Arch-specific.

item.title: TIL: sed regex ranges
item.description: One can use sed and regular expressions to find chunks of text that span multiple line. To look for ranges of lines in other words with sed: sed '/range-start-line-regex/,/range-end-line-regex/ other commands' $file Example I'm a Java developer so the example will be from Java world. I was on a support case and we were trying to debug a problem a customer had. As part of the debugging process we've requested the customer to take a number of thread dumps.
